title: When using lighthouse in combination with Erigon, I have issues with Sepolia peers all the time
body:
## Description

When using `lighthouse` as Erigon CL, I have no other "lighthouse" clients as peers and also have lower number of peers compared to using `ligthhouse` as Geth CL. For Sepolia network this is a huge difference. For other networks it's not that problematic.

## Version

Tried with v3.5.1, v4.1.0, v4.2.0

## Present Behaviour

Two situations, tested with all 3 versions mentioned above.

1. Lighthouse as CL for geth. More peers in general for all networks (30-50). Prysm as most common, after that Lighthouse and Nimbus.
2. Lighthouse as CL for erigon. Less peers in general for Sepolia (0-8). Nimbus/Prysm most common, maybe Teku sometimes. **But no lighthouse clients at all.** If one appears it drops immediately, it's like it's dropping all lighthouse clients for some reason. **This is the biggest issues for Sepolia**, as for that network there are only few Nimbus/Prysm/Teku clients we are finding in network.

For monitoring peers I was using `libp2p_peers_per_client` metric. And this situation is happening for last several months already.

## Expected Behaviour

I would expect lighthouse to behave almost the same nevertheless which EL client I am using.
Do you think you could get some debug logs? Those would help to identify why peers are dropping
Can you specify which exact DEBG logs you would like me to share? There are many of those.

Here I've exported all the logs from the exact lighthouse with mentioned problem. 

It is always stuck between one or two Nimbus/Prysm/Teku peers. No Lighthouse peers at all.
